pulltitle: Prepare to archive repo
pullsbody: This theme was replaced by https://github.com/potch/hax around 2015. This repository should be archived (possibly after renaming it from https://github.com/mozilla/mozhacks to https://github.com/mozilla/mozhacks-2013).
pull_repo_desc: The old/classic hacks.mozilla.org WordPress theme. New theme at https://github.com/potch/hax
pull_commit_message: Link to next theme

pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #47


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: The old/classic hacks.mozilla.org WordPress theme. New theme at https://github.com/potch/hax
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #47.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Improved Readability (style.css)
pullsbody:
The primary font is changed to Open Sans, the same font which is being used on mozilla.org. The line height and margins are also adjusted to improve the reading experience of the users.

![screenshot 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8947356/6982779/d30a5038-da33-11e4-8452-2f3772e990ec.PNG)

pulltitle: Fix bug 1063213 - only flush rewrite rules on theme activation
pullsbody:
Hopefully this solves it though some more thorough testing in a more production-like environment would be very wise.
- Don't flush rules on init (too costly)
- Don't do a hard flush (too destructive)

See http://codex.wordpress.org/Rewrite_API/flush_rules
pull_repo_desc: The old/classic hacks.mozilla.org WordPress theme. New theme at https://github.com/potch/hax
pull_commit_message:
Fix bug 1063213 - only flush rewrite rules on theme activation

* Don't flush rules on init (too costly)
* Don't do a hard flush (too destructive)

See http://codex.wordpress.org/Rewrite_API/flush_rules

pulltitle: Fixed weird timings in Firefox/Android
pullsbody:
Seems e.timeStamp isn't reliable for the simulated mouse events (giving
wrong delta in ms between events). Dirty hack to just use
Date().getTime() instead. Still...works reliably in all browsers now,
from my testing...
pull_repo_desc: The old/classic hacks.mozilla.org WordPress theme. New theme at https://github.com/potch/hax
pull_commit_message:
Fixed weird timings reported in Firefox/Android

Seems e.timeStamp isn't reliable for the simulated mouse events (giving
wrong delta in ms between events). Dirty hack to just use
Date().getTime() instead. Still...works reliably in all browsers now,
from my testing...

pulltitle: Fixing broken touch events demos
pullsbody:
Removed unneeded (?) archive-api.js and related base.css (were these
from another demo?)

Added override on body width in style to counteract fixed-width body
width set in front.css, which was messing with the viewport
optimisation.
pull_repo_desc: The old/classic hacks.mozilla.org WordPress theme. New theme at https://github.com/potch/hax
pull_commit_message:
Fixing broken touch demos

Removed unneeded (?) archive-api.js and related base.css (were these
from another demo?)

Added override on body width in style to counteract fixed-width body
width set in front.css, which was messing with the viewport
optimisation.
